channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA

item.title: Report E-2023120174
item.description:
Report E-2023120174

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: NEWNAN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 5 gallon cans of Asphalt sealer (un1294) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 pint of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023120103
item.description:
Report E-2023120103

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 29, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon poly-drum of corrosive liquid was punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and apron underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in using hand tools. All corrosive liquid-impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew overpacked the one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) new 55-gallon drum that was staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was turned over on its side and the top was not properly close and the product has leaked out. DescribePack: Loose top on bottle DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Once the package handler notices the box was getting wet, she turned it over to prevent any more leakage.

item.title: Report I-2023110012
item.description:
Report I-2023110012

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-22T00:32:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Southwest Airlines F7848 was taxing to take off when a passengers battery power bank was smoking. The flight attendant placed the device in the on-board fire containment bag and ARFF was dispatched to the aircraft. They have detained the aircraft until they can retrieve and check the device contained in the fire containment bag.
